name: The Bath House Luxury Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Bathhouse for 2 nights whilst attending a wedding.
reviews.title: Not so much a B&B, More a Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Could not have been happier with the B&B. It is tucked just away from the city centre, but is only 10 minutes walk at most from all the major attractions- whilst it is situated on one of the main access roads into Bath we had no problem with road traffic at night or in the mornings even with the window open- in sharp contrast to a centre of bath hotel we stayed in 12 months ago that was terribly noisey. The welcome by the owners was lovely- a really nice chance to have a chat with people fully comitted to giving excellent service.
reviews.title: We loved The Bath House B&B!!

reviews.text: Parking is free but like everywhere in bath is a little tight- you might have problems getting a large 4x4 or luxo barge in.
reviews.title: A nice place for visitor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are very well appointed with flat screen tellies and freeview digital TV. Likewise the ensuite was modern, clean and with a multi spray shower also relaxing. nice touches include a little tin of biscuits (not the normal pre packed cheap stuff), a good selection of tea and coffee and a jug of filtered water in case you don't like the tap water (which is perfectly drinkable, but i beleive has been softened). furnishings are comfy and luxurious.
reviews.title: Loved the Bathhouse - perfect stay in Bath

likes.liked: — every aspect, it was a well thought out accommodating place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beds are comfy with feather pillows and duvets (although there were also synthetic if that floats your boat!). If anything the rooms were too warm for me, despite a wet cold weekend although they provide extra heaters and blankets in case you get cold!
reviews.title: Comfortable & Stylish B&B

likes.disliked: — we had a hard time initially finding the place

reviews.text: I stayed here recently with my daughter and wanted to avoid the charge for two separate rooms in a hotel. The two bedroom aprtment was ideal for our requirements. Obviously very recently decorated and equipped the apartment was immaculate and modern. Very conveniently located a short walk from the centre the apartment was great value and for two couples visiting Bath it would be perfect and incredible value. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Style and comfort at great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This accommodation is very central which was great for popping in and out. It was warm, clean, modern and inviting with web access and good tv channel choice (well I am 8 months pregnant..)
reviews.title: Bright & Beautiful in Bath

likes.liked: — The B&B smelt really fresh and clean and looked modern and well kept on entry.
likes.disliked: — Being at the front of the house was a little noisy because of the main road.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being at the front of the house and off an A-road our room was slightly noisy, so it might be worth taking ear plugs if you like to sleep with open windows.
reviews.title: Warm and elegant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was good and anything we asked for - we got, Richard was happy to help.
reviews.title: Home from Home

likes.liked: — its a cut above the rest.........

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: It's probably not the cheapest B&B but I think that it's an average price for good accommodation in Bath, which we found quite an expensive place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend staying here. We stayed for one night at this lovely B&B. They were kind enough to let us book for one night only rather than the usual two nights because they'd had a change in bookings. Everywhere else in Bath is very reluctant to do so. Also the price was very reasonable and if you pay by cash you get a small discount.
reviews.title: Just Perfect - Very homely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was lovely, very modern in a shabby chic kind of way. So clean and the breakfast was amazing. Couldn't have asked for more.
reviews.title: right in the centre of town

likes.disliked: — the biscuits provided with the tea were a bit soft!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accommodation is close to all the tourist attractions including the wonderful Thermae Bath Spa, which The Bath House provided discount tickets for.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking is available free of charge.
reviews.title: Definitely a bit of luxury.

reviews.text: Enjoy!
reviews.title: Wonderful luxury B&B

reviews.text: My (now) husband and I have recently returned from a 4-night stay in Bath. Our wedding took place at a venue not far from the city centre and, with friends coming from overseas, we wanted to book fairly upmarket accommodation (in keeping with the festivities!) but at a reasonable rate. The Bath House proved the ideal solution.
reviews.title: Be spoilt for less

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms (we booked three) were spacious and clean and the comfortable four poster bed and the enormous shower helped make the bride feel special as did the champagne and balloons that were waiting in our room on our wedding night!
reviews.title: Great find in Bath

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was always delivered to the bedroom door at a time requested by us. This was true even when we were late with our breakfast request (sorry!) and is just one example of how the staff provided a highly professional service with the minimum of fuss. The location (5 minutes walk from the city centre; 10 minutes walk from the train station), the free parking and the free WI-FI were added benefits.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B

reviews.text: You could stay at one of the very expensive 'luxury' hotels in Bath. Alternatively, you could book a room at the Bath House - be spoilt for less at Bath's luxury B&B!
reviews.title: A home from home

reviews.text: Just returned from two nights at the Bath House. Great B&B, 5 mins to all of Bath's sights, clean bathroom and lots of thought put in by the owners to cater for all needs. Added bonus of 4-poster bed and free parking. Would recommend highly.
reviews.title: A cute and cozy B & B in Bath

description: A luxury B&B (and luxury serviced apartments) in the heart of Bath, just five minutes level walk to all major attractions including the Crescent, Spa, Abbey and Roman Baths. Stylish AIR-CONDITIONED en-suite B&B rooms with king-size beds, free Wi-Fi, LCD TVs, iPod docks, fridges, hairdryers, fluffy towels, information guides and a generous hospitality tray. For extra pampering, breakfast is served in the PRIVACY OF YOUR OWN ROOM. Luxury 1 and 2 bed Apartments also available - ideal for families, couples, small groups or corporate bookings.
